cards.name: Memory Berry
text: Attach Memory Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

The Pokémon this card is attached to can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon or its Stage 1 Evolution card. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.) If that Pokémon attacks, discard this card at the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Mischief
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Anger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Windstorm
text: Choose up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon Tool cards and Stadium cards in play (both yours and your opponent's) and discard them.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Dynamic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Aggron ex

ability.name: Intimidating Armor
ability.text: As long as Aggron ex is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack or use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Burn
attacks.text: During your next turn, Aggron ex can't use Mega Burn.

attacks.name: Show Off
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Wave
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Mat Block
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Paint Roller
text: Discard any Stadium card in play. Then, draw a card.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Pineco does 50 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Hard Bite
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Baltoy
text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Future Spin
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.

ability.name: Farewell Letter
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may discard this Pokémon and all cards attached to it (this does not count as a Knock Out). If you do, draw a card.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Nidoking does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

attacks.name: Wicked Jab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Challenge!
text: Ask your opponent if he or she accepts your challenge. If your opponent declines (or if both Benches are full), draw 2 cards. If your opponent accepts, each of you searches your decks for any number of Basic Pokémon cards and puts them face down onto your Benches. (A player can't do this if his or her Bench is full.) When you both have finished, shuffle your decks and turn those cards face up.

attacks.name: Twiddle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

ability.name: Barrier Shrine
ability.text: Each player can't play any Stadium cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Blaziken ex
text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Burn Away
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out by this attack, Blaziken ex does damage to itself equal to this attack's damage minus the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

cards.name: Captivating Poké Puff
text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Put any number of Basic Pokémon you find there onto your opponent's Bench.

cards.name: Lucky Helmet
text: Whenever the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Power Heater
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon. Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to each of those Pokémon.

cards.name: Rainbow Energy
text: Attach Rainbow Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Rainbow Energy counts as every type of basic Energy but only provides 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play.) When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, it does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) (Major text change in Ruby/Sapphire. Requires reference.)

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Potion Energy
text: If you play this card from your hand, remove 1 damage counter from the Pokémon you attach it to, if it has any. Potion Energy provides energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

attacks.name: Double Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10).

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Delcatty ex

ability.name: Constrain
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Each player discards cards until that player has 6 cards in his or her hand. (You discard first.) This power can't be used if Delcatty ex is affected by a Special Condition.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Upstream
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for all Energy cards. This attack does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards you find there. Show them to your opponent, and put them on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Celebi Star

ability.name: Time Travel
ability.text: If Celebi Star would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may flip a coin. If heads, Celebi Star is not Knocked Out, discard all cards attached to Celebi Star, and put Celebi Star on the bottom of your deck.

text: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Leaf Shade
attacks.text: Count the amount of Energy attached to Celebi Star. Put that many damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cotton Bed
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Tongue Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

ability.name: Floral Scent
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Wartortle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Plunge
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Marshtomp is on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, move all Energy cards attached to your Active Pokémon to Marshtomp. If you do, switch Marshtomp with that Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, flip another coin. If the second coin is heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If the second coin is tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon

attacks.name: Lure Poison
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Spit Squall
attacks.text: Your opponent puts the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her hand.

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Mirage Stadium
text: Whenever a player tries to Retreat a Pokémon during his or her turn, that player flips a coin. If heads, that player retreats that Pokémon (and discards Energy normally). If tails, that Pokémon can't Retreat this turn (the player doesn't discard any Energy).

cards.name: Crushing Hammer
text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Poké Ball
text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Lysandre
text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleeping Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Destiny Bond
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Gastly in order to use this attack. If a Pokémon Knocks Out Gastly during your opponent's next turn, Knock Out that Pokémon.

cards.name: Pokémon Catcher
text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Continuous Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Level Ball
text: Search your deck for a Pokémon with 90 HP or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Rhyhorn during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

cards.name: Energy Recycler
text: Shuffle 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

cards.name: Forest of Giant Plants
text: Each player's Grass Pokémon can evolve during his or her first turn or the turn he or she plays those Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Charmander in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Fairy Power
attacks.text: Return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Cell Storm
attacks.text: Discard 2 Psychic Energy attached to Deoxys and remove 6 damage counters from Deoxys.

attacks.name: Heavy Bullet
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Dark Provide
attacks.text: Attach up to 1 Grass or Darkness Energy card from your hand to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leaf Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Flash Energy
text: This card can only be attached to Lightning Pokémon. This card provides Lightning Energy only while this card is attached to a Lightning Pokémon. The Lightning Pokémon this card is attached to has no Weakness. (If this card is attached to anything other than a Lightning Pokémon, discard this card.)

attacks.name: Sand-attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Super Speed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Sand-Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fire Slash
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Squirtle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Foul Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned; if tails, it is now Confused.

attacks.name: Solar Suggestion
attacks.text: Move up to 4 damage counters from any of your Pokémon to any of your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Blaze Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Recharge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Shinx. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Vanish
attacks.text: Shuffle Abra into your deck. (Discard all cards attached to Abra.)

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Inviting Poison
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Flower Tornado
attacks.text: Move any number of Grass Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Volcano Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard the top 4 cards of your opponent's deck. If tails, discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Super Energy Removal
text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokémon in order to choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and up to 2 Energy cards attached to it. Discard those energy cards.
